snippet: The state may finally settle a class-action suit and set the stage for a public-defense system that lets lawyers do their jobs competently.
abstract: Editorial contends New York State has violated rights of thousands of poor defendants in criminal cases by failing to provide them with no or inadequate lawyer; notes 2007 class-action suit brought by New York Civil Liberties Union and law firm Schulte Roth & Zabel challenging near-total failure of public defense services in five upstate counties is coming to trial; offers hope that case may help establish needed state-run public defense system.
lead_paragraph: The state may finally settle a class-action suit and set the stage for a public-defense system that lets lawyers do their jobs competently.

headline.main: New York’s Big Chance on Public Defense
headline.print_headline: New York’s Big Chance on Public Defense
